meanings.sent1: After eating the old food, he felt sicker than before.
meanings.sent2: She looked sicker today than she did yesterday.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed sicker after trying to eat the spicy chili.
meanings.sent4: The storm made the sea sicker, tossing the boat around violently.
meanings.sent5: The flu made him sicker than he had ever been in his life.

meanings.sent1: The sicker door wouldn't budge no matter how hard he pushed.
meanings.sent2: Her belief in magic was sicker than her fear of the dark.
meanings.sent3: The sicker tree stood tall against the strong winds.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was sicker than any disagreement they faced.
meanings.sent5: The sicker rules of the game were never to be broken.

meanings.definition: In a more secure or stable manner.
meanings.sent1: She tied the knot sicker this time to prevent it from coming loose.
meanings.sent2: He held onto the railing sicker as the train sped around the bend.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hid its acorn sicker than usual, fearing theft.
meanings.sent4: The secret was kept sicker than a treasure buried deep underground.
meanings.sent5: The child held onto his mother's hand sicker in the crowded market.
